frame.name: Hearsay
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Hearer</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> or communication on a particular <fen>Topic</fen>. Words in this frame denote events of verbal communication, but express the <fen>Hearer</fen> rather than the <fen>Speaker</fen> as an External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Hearer">Teenage fans</fex> first <t>heard</t> <fex name="Topic">about the tragedy</fex> <fex name="Medium">on a popular radio show</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Hearer">Teenage fans</fex> first <t>heard</t> <fex name="Message">the tragic news</fex> <fex name="Medium">on a popular radio show</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who produces a Message. Typically, it is expressed in this frame as a PP-complement headed by <ment>from</ment>:
<ex>The students <t>heard</t> <fex name="Speaker">from Pat</fex> that class was canceled.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Hearer
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the person who receives a Message. It is expressed as an Exteranal Argument in this frame: <ex><fex name="Hearer">The students</fex> <t>heard</t> from Pat that class was canceled.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The Message is the content that is communicated from one person to another. It is normally expressed as an NP Object or a finite clause Complement: <ex>The students <t>heard</t> <fex name="Message">the news</fex>.</ex><ex>The students <t>heard</t> from Pat <fex name="Message">that class was canceled</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>Topic is the subject matter about which the Message is communicated. It is normally expressed as a PP-complement headed by <ment>about</ment>, with or without a quantificational noun: <ex>The students <t>heard</t> <fex name="Topic">about class</fex>.</ex><ex>The students <t>heard</t> something <fex name="Topic">about today's class</fex>.</ex> The quantificational noun, if present, is treated as the Message. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the Message. It is normally expressed as a PP-complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>: <ex>The students <t>heard</t> the news <fex name="Medium">on the radio</fex>.</ex><ex>The students <t>read</t> the news <fex name="Medium">in the paper</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> the <fen>Hearer</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen>. <ex>I <t>heard</t> <fex name="ti">in June</fex> that Pablo left, how sad!</ex></def-root>
